meta.description: This is the home page of a client-side XSLT framework documentation.

content.p: At a team meeting in 2015, we watched this video:

Throughout the video, I was reminded of something I'd filed away in 2003. A method which wasn't widely supported then, but would be now: client side . It certainly doesn't do everything which Web Components does, but it allows us to use code such as this:
... and replace it client-side with more complicated . But without any JavaScript.
To my surprise, client-side wasn't just being ignored, there wasn't even a build-ready framework for developers to start from. So I wrote one.
